title: Efforts to impeach Joe Biden
deleted: :''This open draft remains in progress as of January 1, 2021.''

title: Efforts to impeach Joe Biden
deleted: === First impeachment trial of Donald Trump ===

In February 2020, Iowa Senator [[Joni Ernst]] suggested that if Biden were elected, he could be impeached over alleged dealings with [[Ukraine]].<ref name="Bloomberg-Ernst">{{Cite web|last1=Epstein|first1=Jennifer|date=February 2, 2020|title=Joe Biden Could Be Impeached by GOP Over Ukraine If He Wins, Iowa Senator Says|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-02/ernst-warns-of-gop-push-to-impeach-biden-over-ukraine-if-he-wins|publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]}}</ref>

In Trump's defense during the trial, [[Florida Attorney General|Florida attorney general]] [[Pam Bondi]] dedicated most of her time discussing the motive behind Trump's actions, citing the conspiracy theory involving the Bidens and Burisma, saying, "We would prefer not to be talking about this. But the House managers have placed this squarely at issue, so we must address it." She repeated allegations that Joe Biden had sought the removal of Ukrainian prosecutor general Viktor Shokin, who was ostensibly investigating the firm that employed Hunter Biden, though this action was in agreement with the [[foreign policy of the United States]] and other Western governments towards Ukraine at the time. Bondi did not mention that both Western governments and [[non-governmental organization]]s had sought Shokin's removal because they believed he was corrupt and that the Burisma investigation had gone dormant under him.<ref name=Wagner>{{cite news |url=https://www.cnn.com/politics/live-news/trump-impeachment-trial-01-27-20/h_a531765a89c09f4406c6e31f91d1d857 |title=Fact check: 4 things Trump's attorney left out of her arguments about Biden and Burisma |last1=Wagner |first1=Meg |last2=Hayes |first2=Mike |last3=Rocha |first3=Veronica |date=January 27, 2020 |publisher=[[CNN]] |access-date=January 28, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200128035420/https://www.cnn.com/politics/live-news/trump-impeachment-trial-01-27-20/h_a531765a89c09f4406c6e31f91d1d857 |archive-date=January 28, 2020 |url-status=live }}</ref> Bondi also falsely asserted that ''The New York Times'' reported in 2015 that Shokin was investigating Burisma and its owner.<ref>{{cite web|last=Blake|first=Aaron|date=January 28, 2020|title=The gaping hole in Trump's impeachment defense|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/01/28/gaping-hole-trumps-impeachment-defense/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200131115457/https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/01/28/gaping-hole-trumps-impeachment-defense/|archive-date=January 31, 2020|access-date=February 1, 2020|work=The Washington Post}}</ref>

title: Efforts to impeach Joe Biden
added: On January 13, 2021, Congresswoman [[Marjorie Taylor Greene]] ([[Republican Party (United States)|R]]-[[Georgia (U.S. state)|Ga]].) stated that she would file articles of impeachment against Joe Biden alleging abuse of power on January 21, 2021, the day after Biden's inauguration, further stating in an interview that "We cannot have a President of the United States that is willing to abuse the power of the presidency and be easily bought off by foreign governments, Chinese energy companies, Ukrainian energy companies".<ref name="Newsweek 1-13-21">{{cite web|last1=Martin|first1=Jeffery|date=January 13, 2021|title=QAnon-Linked Congresswoman to File Impeachment Articles Against Biden on January 21|url=https://www.newsweek.com/qanon-linked-congresswoman-file-impeachment-articles-against-biden-january-21-1561414|publisher=[[Newsweek]]}}</ref>
On January 20, 2021, Joe Biden was inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States. Senator Kamala Harris was sworn in as the Vice President of the United States.

title: Efforts to impeach Joe Biden
added: The impeachment, however, is unlikely to succeed because of the fact that the current House and Senate is Democratically controlled.

title: Efforts to impeach Joe Biden
added: An inquiry by two Republican-controlled Senate committees released six weeks before the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]] found no wrongdoing by Biden.<ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/23/us/politics/biden-inquiry-republicans-johnson.html</ref>
